content.definition: A fibroinflammatory condition affecting the aorta and its branches as part of IgG4-related disease (IgG4-RD), characterized by lymphoplasmacytic infiltration with abundant IgG4-positive plasma cells, storiform fibrosis, and obliterative phlebitis. May present as inflammatory aortic aneurysm, periaortitis, or retroperitoneal fibrosis with vascular involvement.

systemic_manifestations: Other organ IgG4-RD (pancreas, salivary glands, kidney)
imaging_features: Periaortic mass encasing but not obstructing

pathophysiology.mechanism: IgG4-expressing plasma cell infiltration with fibrosis
histologic_triad: Dense lymphoplasmacytic infiltrate with IgG4+ cells

surgical_indications: Aneurysm meeting size criteria despite medical therapy

prognosis.complications: Aneurysm rupture, dissection, ureteral obstruction from RPF

learning_objectives: Recognize IgG4-RD as cause of inflammatory aneurysm
Know the histologic triad of IgG4-RD
Understand excellent response to steroids but high relapse rate
clinical_pearls: Periaortic 'soft tissue rind' on CT is characteristic
Serum IgG4 is elevated in only 75% of cases - not required for diagnosis
Screen for multi-organ involvement (pancreas, kidneys, salivary glands)
High relapse rate necessitates long-term follow-up
